column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Diy_coref|
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Diy_coref_re|BT_webanno.custom.Diy_coref
#Text=Referring now to FIG. 9, gutter sections may alternatively be telescopically interconnected.
#Text=In this regard, a specially sized gutter section 90 may be provided to telescopically receive the downstream end of a gutter section 10.
#Text=Since the downstream end of a gutter section 10 is larger than the upstream end, it will not be readily received in the channel of an upstream end of a successive gutter section.
#Text=Therefore, a specially sized gutter section 90 of larger cross-section may be provided.
#Text=It will be appreciated by those of skill in the art that the gutter system described herein can be constructed of any commonly used materials including sheet metal, aluminum, plastic or vinyl.
#Text=The only consideration regarding material is expansion and contraction.
#Text=The illustrations and descriptions shown herein assume a non-expanding/contracting gutter material such as sheet metal.
#Text=Appropriate modification, however, for expanding materials will be appreciated by persons skilled in the art.

#Text=Described below is the typical process that may be followed by an installer: Gutter section 10 is pre-assembled with upstream end-cap 50, bracket/leveling assemblies 20, wood screws 16 and 21, and gutter screen 30.
#Text=Placing the ladder approximately 2 feet from the end of the building roof, the installer may carry up the upstream end of said gutter section and place it against the fascia board 4.
#Text=Wood screw 16 may be partially screwed into end of the fascia board 4.
#Text=Gutter section 10 may then be held in an approximately level manner.
#Text=Using the leveling assembly, plumb line 22 is aligned with slope markings 23 to either level or adjust the desired slope.
#Text=Screws 21 are screwed into the fascia board 4.
#Text=Screw 16 may then be completely tightened.
#Text=The leveling plumb line 22 and weight 26 may then be removed.

#Text=Successively placing the ladder between pairs of bracket assemblies that are 3-4 feet apart, this process is repeated across the entire length of gutter section 10 until either the end of said gutter section is reached or the opposite end of the building structure is reached.

#Text=If the building structure length exceeds the length of said gutter section, either a variable length center mount assembly 70, variable length downspout opening 80, or gutter connection 90 may be utilized.
#Text=The foregoing description has been presented for purposes of illustration and description.
#Text=It is not intended to be exhaustive or to limit the invention to the precise forms disclosed.
#Text=Obvious modifications or variations are possible in light of the above teachings.

#Text=The embodiment or embodiments discussed were chosen and described to provide the best illustration of the principles of the invention and its practical application to thereby enable one of ordinary skill in the art to utilize the invention in various embodiments and with various modifications as are suited to the particular use contemplated.

#Text=All such modifications and variations are within the scope of the invention as determined by the appended claims when interpreted in accordance with the breadth to which they are fairly and legally entitled.
